metadata.value:
with the papers dated 1768  [written in top margin of paper in pencil at later date]

To the Honorable Gentlemen and Society of Saint Andrew

Sheweth that your Petitioner Ann Sturgon [Sturgeon] was Born South Ferry Porting Creggs [South FerryPort on Craig, modern day Tayport] Six miles from Saint Andrews has been in this Province Since the Year after the Hurricane and was Married to John Sturgon by the Reverend Mr. Smith in the year 1761 21st July. Five years Since the said John my Husband was drowned in Charles Town River and as your Petitioner is a poor woman and is in want of Common necessaries in Life and in age therefore humbly begs your humane and Charitable assistance at this time in my distress which I now Labour under for which God of his Infinite goodness reward you for under God I may say you have Saved the Life of your necessiated [necessitated] Country Woman and am in duty bound to give you the prayers of the Widow for which Shall ever pray

Ann Sturgon --
